page.title: 11WIDFORD LODGE CHELMSFORD
page.content: Widford Lodge is a{Preparatory School for boys.When the School was first opened it had 9 pupils and during World War II only 3 boys attended. Now there are 152 pupils.{The fees}are as follows:-Day Boys (7-14) Â£605 per term Weekly Boarders (7-14) Â£765 per term; Pre-Prep.(4-7),Â£320 per term. Before being converted to a School, the building was a private house,built about 1845. Mr.H.M.Witham is the Headmaster and the School owns 11 acres of land and 9 of these are taken up by playing fields. Alterations have been made to the Lodge since its conversion to a School; the Maids quarters are now Staff flats and 2 dormitories have been converted into the Headmaster's flat.The School celebrated its 50th. year in 1985 with the opening of a new building for the Pre-Prep age range.
